Problem:
Study the effect of a complex function \\( z \mapsto e^{iz} \\) on a real variable \\( x \\) and its integration relating to the Fourier transform of a signal \\( s(t) \), represented as \\( S(f) = \int_{-\infty}^{\infty} s(t) e^{-i2\pi f t} dt. \\)

From observing the altered Fourier transform \\( S'(f) \\), is it possible to confirm if the transformation \\( z \mapsto e^{iz} \\) was applied on the input signal \\( s(t) \\)?
Explanation: Knowledge of the transformed Fourier transform alone \\( S'(f) \\) without additional context does not confirm that \\( z \mapsto e^{iz} \\) was applied, as other transformations could produce similarly altered spectral characteristics.
